entry.title: Mystery pelt nets Wairarapa taxidermist a big pay day

media:group.media:title: Mystery pelt nets Wairarapa taxidermist a big pay day
media:group.media:description: John McCosh had been holding onto a pelt for 30 years at his taxidermy museum but had no idea what it was. media:group.media:description:
Entire towns have been evacuated, with new accounts of dramatic escapes, 1 NEWS US correspondent Anna Burns-Francis reports. Join the 6pm team as they bring you the latest news from here and overseas Daily at 6pm on TVNZ 1

media:group.media:title: THE LONG FIGHT
media:group.media:description: Margaret and Jock Jamieson want to keep the man who killed Margaret's parents in jail, but, after 26 years inside, Gresham Marsh has just been released. Where? They don't know. Has he changed? They doubt it. The head of Police at the scene of the double-murder called it an “execution” and says the killer showed no remorse. Now, the Jamiesons believe Marsh could be a threat to them, and they want a photo of him.

entry.title: National's promise to 'crack down' on meth not enough - community social service group

media:group.media:title: National's promise to 'crack down' on meth not enough - community social service group
media:group.media:description:

media:group.media:description: The alternative soil additive is carbon that's been specially burnt and, like a sponge, it holds onto water, oxygen and nutrients.
